DOC.brief_summary: This study design evaluate safety efficacy PN2034 insulin-dependent type 2 diabetic measure change average daily insulin dose baseline week 12 . The effect PN2034 HbA1c , fast plasma glucose ( FPG ) , lipid level also measure .
DOC.brief_title: Effects PN2034 Insulin-Dependent Patients With Type 2 Diabetes
DOC.criteria: diagnose type 2 diabetes mellitus 21 65 year age stable dos insulin ( > /= 40 units/day ) alone metformin least 3 month HbA1c level > /=7.5 % < /=10.0 % fast blood sugar level > /= 125 mg/dL < /= 279 mg/dL BMI 2643 kg/m2 direct bilirubin < 1.5x upper limit normal ( ULN ) serum creatinine < 1.5 mg/dL ( male ) < 1.4 mg/dL ( female ) blood urea nitrogen ( BUN ) < /=40 mg/dL clinical laboratory parameter ( hematology , serum chemistry , urinalysis ) within normal limit clinically significant ECG normal , abnormality clinically significant surgically sterile , postmenopausal , use adequate contraception negative pregnancy test Screening able perform daily selfmonitoring blood glucose ( SMBG ) test willing able sign inform consent form diagnose type 1 diabetes mellitus history ketoacidosis treatment TZDs oral antidiabetic ( exclude metformin ) within 3 month prior screen study treatment change lipidlowering medication within 2 month screen take systemic corticosteroid within 1 month prior screen study treatment history current/active cardiovascular disease significant current pulmonary condition significant thyroid disease CPK value > 3x ULN female pregnant lactate systolic BP > 160 mm Hg diastolic BP > 90 mm Hg screen previous current history cancer , basal cell stage 1 squamous cell carcinoma skin , remission within 5 year prior randomization liver function test ( ALT , AST , ALP ) > 2 time ULN , active liver disease screen history positive HIV positive hepatitis B test screen weight loss gain > /= 15 lb within 3 month screen history substance abuse ( include alcohol abuse ) within 2 year prior screen donate and/or receive blood blood product within 3 month prior randomization take investigational study medication within 30 day prior screen study
